name: Jack Stevens
text: Very good food and they have a great Sushi Bar!. It's a little hidden but in a convenient tucked away from all the chaos of shops at Veatavia Center. Not too formal but still a good date night destination.

name: Nicholas Toth
text: Our server, Veronica was amazing and took care of us in every way possible. I wish I could give this restaurant 6 stars. The food was amazing and the service was astounding. Everything was cooked perfectly on my chicken tempura meal and I was surprised by how hot and fresh everything was. Every bite I took was better than the last. I will be returning.

name: Linda Luccasen
text: Absolutely the best sushi around!..Sara and all the staff are extremely polite and helpful and the sushi is not only fantastic but beautifully presented...There is a very large sushi menu and the hibachi grill items are also delicious!....Great lunch items as well...must try!!

name: Comic fan 9407
text:
Great restaurant, One of my favorites to go to on special occasions
The takoyaki is absolute delicious!!!
The new York roll is great and filling
and the food is very healthy

name: Mead Samuel
text: I went with my friends and our waitress Veronica  she was  a bomb very helpful and service great highly recommend this place

name: Guy Dewees
text: Always a good experience here

name: Jeffrey Cowgill
text:
We dined in on their patio for lunch. Even for September it was comfortable. We’ve been coming here for years. Even before it was Samurai Japan. They continue to have great food and sushi. The bento box at lunch is a great deal with lots of choices and plenty of servings. The service is good and not overbearing. They also have a full bar. We’ll be back. It’s kind of a secret location so go but don’t tell too many people about our tasty secret.

UrbanCowgill
Sept 2021

name: VT B
text: Great Sushi & Friendly Staff!

name: Matt McKenzie
text: My favorite sushi place in town. They never disappoint and it's even good with a larger group of friends. Because of how great they are, you'll want to make a reservation on popular nights because it fills up fast!

name: Summer Campbell
text: I Love this place! The sushi is so fresh & so clean clean but normally I get salmon sashimi with a seaweed salad. I'll mix the shaved radish the sashimi is served over

name: Pamela Cotgrove
text:
We had a gift certificate for this restaurant so we decided to go this evening for a Mother's Day celebration.

Before I begin, let me preface by saying that the restaurant was not busy, we were one of maybe 10 tables occupied, most of which were parties of 2-3 persons, and there were maybe 4 people at the

The food was mediocre, the prices seemed inflated for the quality and preparation and then there was the service - or the absence of service I should say!

The server had a look that was a cross between someone who hated people and that of someone who was continuously sucking on a lemon, which was only matched by his complete lack of personality.  He didn't smile at all and several times asked a question and then walked off without waiting for an answer.

We waited 5 minutes before he came to the table to take drink orders.  He second guessed our entire order, as though he assumed we knew nothing about food or what or how much we wanted.  The server brought us the salad that came with the dinner and the miso soup.  The soup was weak and the tofu tasted like it had been tossed in literally just before service.  When we finished, he brought us some tempura we had ordered, and while we were working on that, he brought out our daughter's dinner and then NOTHING for 25 minutes!  So our daughter was completely through with her meal and unoccupied when we finally did receive our plates.  Add this to the fact that our sushi didn't arrive until half way through our dinner plates, which to me suggests that either the server did not know the abilities of the back chefs and the sushi chefs OR there is no sense of timing, in either event it just added to the lousy service.  The final straw was waiting 10 minutes to get the check and then having 18% gratuity automatically added to the check.  WHAT A JOKE!

A word to the wise, this is NOT the place to enjoy great food.  If I could give this place zero out of five I would!

name: Elizabeth Marie
text: Expensive for what it is. Mediocre food. The "house salad" was a small cup of limp, shredded iceberg lettuce that looked very similar to the lettuce in Taco Bell tacos. I spent $1.50 on what tasted like a cup of hot water that was supposedly hot tea. The Croquette Vegetable Potato appetizer was just fried potato patties that tasted like puréed, wet potato. Perhaps we just got unlucky with what we ordered, but it was all subpar and expensive. I would not recommend going.

name: Jessica Boyd
text: August 7, 2015-This is by far the best food we have ever eaten! It is now called Samurai Japan and is under new ownership as of five days ago! The cajun fillet mignon and sushi are ah-mazing! The staff is absolutely incredible. We can't wait to go back!

name: Ripley
text: awesome sushi and ramen, the wasabi steamed dumplings are great too. good service, good food, reasonable prices. will be going on a regular basis.

name: Nthenic
text: Very good food, service and ambience! I recommend the Sauteed Shitake!

name: Michael Johnson
text: Authentic Japanese. The people working there KNOW the food. Don't be afraid to ask questions. This isn't your "onion choo choo" habaci grill Japanese. The entrees and noodle dishes are great. Like spicy? Try the Wasabi Shumai. Overall it is hard to beat.

name: matt geiken
text: We had dinner hear last night. Sushi was very good and well priced. They even have several dishes and special rolls for kids. The bartender was also our waitress and she was very polite and friendly. We would definite definitely go again next time we are in town.

name: Daniel Pendley
text: Great sushi- $1.25 for 3 pieces on Mondays. Great menu all around. Lunch is good deal. Some of the best Thai food in town and some very tasty pan Asian options! Wine special on Thursdays

name: ian kornmeyer
text:
Asian Rim was across from our hotel and we thought we'd give it a try.  Overall, I'm glad we went and we would go back.

We tried the fish tacos and some sushi.  The fish tacos come thoroughly doused in coleslaw and big enough to be difficult to eat without a double-jointed jaw. They were full of fresh veggies and the fish was good.  The sushi was a Rainbow Roll and some nigiri.  The fish was all fresh and the portions were appropriate for the price.

Our sweet tea came out hot enough to melt the included ice.

name: Lee Osbourn
text: If you've never eaten at Asian Rim, grab your keys and head over there!  It's a great little place with a nice atmosphere and the staff are very friendly. I usually have the Dragon's tail(i think its called). I always like to try something different when i go,  but I've never been disappointed.

name: Paige H.
text: Asian Rim is our favorite place in Birmingham, AL. They have a wide variety of delicious food where I can enjoy Thai or Sushi and my husband can delight in a juicy steak. The staff is friendly, the place is upscale casual, and it's a local hotspot near our home. Many out of town diners are pleasantly surprised that this local gem.

name: ninalita84
text: This was certainly a surprise to find in Birmingham!  I used to travel there for business and never let a trip go by without visiting this restaurant.  Their sushi is amazing and I found the service to always be prompt and attentive.

name: Jacqueline Dorris
text: We stayed at the hotel right next door and saw the reviews of this place and figured we would try it out. We were very disappointed. Food was bland and dried out. Atmosphere was a little weird (the bartender was playing something on her phone from Pandora) that was super strange and not typical of an Asian cuisine restaurant... she seemed a little spacey. I found that when comparing the prices to the quality of the food, it just didn't add up.

name: B R
text: Ive had the worst sushi I've ever tasted here, it's a shame bc we used to love this place. As a military wife we have been all over the country and I have never encountered such awful customer service after voicing my concerns about our meal. They used to be the best but have since gone down hill with the quality of their fish. The owners need to take lessons on customer service and handling criticism professionally with out taking it personally.

name: Spencer Stantis
text: Really great place serving a variety of Asian food. They have something for everyone.

name: Meliah Miranda
text: Asian Rim was FABULOUS!!!  Close to the Drury Inn.  Food was great, service was fantastic. All-in-all, we enjoyed it.

name: Ryan Hanson
text: Great services and delicious sushi. A great place to eat in a really nice restaurant.

name: Anna Harmon
text: Excellent service. Soup was amazing. Sushi was okay, not great.

name: Heather Rowell
text: One of the best dinner experiences.  Peking Duck Rolls, Macadamia Pineapple Sushi,  Salmon and Chocolate Ginger Mousse. Mmm... :)

name: Geralyn Sigler
text: Always a pleasure to eat here! GREAT food, drinks and atmosphere!

name: Parker 205
text: It was a great place but it's now closed

name: Sarah Smith
text: Pretty good Asian restaurant for Birmingham. They have good lunch specials.

name: abbie t
text:
Asian Rim, specifically the manager Colton, turned what was supposed to be a relaxing dinner with my family into a three hour nightmare. It was failure after failure, and I have never before been subjected to such poor customer service.  That’s the short version.

This is the full story. I ordered (and paid for) delivery from Asian Rim through Yelp Eat24 and, after waiting an hour and a half without getting any food or as much as a phone call, I called the restaurant directly to ask when I could expect my meal. I was informed by Colton that there was no order because they don’t associate with Yelp Eat24 at all. Understandably, this freaked me out and lead me to believe I had been scammed. I then called Yelp Eat24 and demanded a refund after telling them what Colton had said. While they did quickly offer a me a refund (which –side note-- I won’t be getting for “up to 5 business days”), they were adamant that they did in fact work with Asian Rim and that their restaurant had actually already confirmed the order before I had called. I was still falsely placing my faith in Asian Rim at this time.

After hanging up with Yelp Eat24, I hurriedly called my bank to inform them that I might have falsely been charged. All of this was quite time consuming and anxiety inducing. On a whim, I decided to call Asian Rim back again and relay to them the information I had been given by the representative at Yelp Eat24 for their own benefit. That’s when Colton then informed me that they did actually work with Yelp Eat24 after all. He just hadn’t known a third party, Backdoor, was also involved and it was their name coming up in his system. He unapologetically told me the food I had originally ordered would be at my house shortly.

But was it? No. So after even more time elapsed, I called Asian Rim a third time to ask what was going on. I was told by a different person that I should “just try calling Backdoor.” I had to flat out demand to be told if the food had at least left Asian Rim yet. She finally said “yeah.” No apologies were given and I was rushed off the phone.

Then I called Backdoor and was told that they did pick up the food from Asian Rim, but then realized the order had been cancelled. Aside from the refund Yelp Eat24 says they will give me, no other amends have even been attempted to be made. To reiterate-- his whole ordeal lasted about 3 hours from the time I placed and paid for the order to the time I was definitively told that there was no food coming. To say this place, and Colton specifically, handled this poorly is an understatement. I adamantly advise everyone reading this to refrain from ordering from Asian Rim.

name: Aaron Gray
text: Excellent sushi here. The red dragon roll and bagel rolls are my favorite.

name: David Gibson
text: Love the Drunken Noodle here... great sushi.. never a long line at lunch...

name: Shane “Sandaddio” Gibbs

name: J / K / S
text:
The portions were fairly small but seemed fresh enough.  The staff was friendly but the place just misses.

There are other places I think are better for sushi in town.

name: Nikki Aaron
text:
This place has food that is so-so, it really depends on what you order.

They are really miserly about things like coupons, substitutions, and letting you reorder when something is just not good. My friend got refused service because she doesn't eat rice (only fish) during the midnight sushi buffet.

The waiters are really friendly, but sometimes do not serve well or quickly. Luckily, this place is a little cheaper than some of the other sushi places in town, because it is definitely not better!

name: Jennifer Whitworth
text: My husband and I visited this restaurant because we had a coupon.  Neither of us eat sushi so we elected to dine off of the other menu items.  I ordered a noodle dish and my husband ordered steak.  The portions were tiny and the noodles were extremely salty.  My husband's steak was so small and it didn't have any sides to accompany it.  Needless to say, I didn't eat my dish and his was too small so we had to go eat after we left.  I wouldn't recommend this restaurant based on their non-sushi menu.

name: Grant Cothran
text: If you love sushi you know it's all about the rice. This place has it. Enough said.

name: Sandra Dozier
text: Had the steak and shrimp combo. Both were very tasty, not over cooked. Vegtables just like I like them crisp, but not mushy.. Fried rice needs a little step up. Over all great experience. Staff very attentive. Will definitely revisit.

name: Trinh Phan
text: Everything was wonderful. The food and the services were great!

name: Niki P (Niki)
text: This place is super convenient, reasonably priced, friendly staff and the food was delicious. That chicken!!! I'm looking forward to trying everything on the menu.

name: Sanford White (The Amazing Life of Who?)
text: We are some of the first visitors; I'm glad Sonya and the family decided open a Japanese Hibachi style and sushi restaurant so close.  The food is great and priced well; it's like visiting friends and hanging out together.  We recommend that you stop by; two thumbs up from our experience.

name: Stuart Nash
text: For the price and convenience, this place is great!  My family and I will definitely be back.

name: Heath Barnett
text: Wow! Amazing sushi just down the road from my neighborhood. Delicious! The chef obviously took pride in the quality and the presentation. I'm excited you are here!

name: Emmet O'Neal
text: You can get a hibachi filet mignon dinner with fried rice and stir fry vegetables for $13. Not only that, the filet mignon is delicious. I couldn’t believe that, delicious filet mignon for $13. High quality, reasonable prices, quick service and plenty on the menu from hibachi to bento to appetizers to sushi. We sampled a lot of the menu and enjoyed it all. Fun night for me, my wife, and our 1 year old. Please come support this local business. I want to be able to enjoy it with my family for years to come.

name: Nikkie Foth
text: The food was very good and the service was even better! My partner and I really love this place

name: KWDrummer
text: Had the filet mignon bento box, it was great!

name: Charles Tucker
text: Great food and very friendly people. Will def be back.

name: Angus DeBoer
text: Leo sucks at minecraft xd

text: This place is so good! I ordered the #3, I think it's called a bihbi bowl or something. I've ordered this each time I've gone because I liked it so much. I keep telling myself I'm going to try something different. I've had Korean a few times and wasn't crazy about it. This place has me rethinking my stance on Korean.

name: Sherry M
text: Korean food was ok, not great. They used the long grain Jasmine rice instead of the short grain sticky rice in my meal. The meat was fatty and sauce was different than the norm for the dish. Unfortunately there aren't many options for Korean food so I will take what I can get.

text: Nice selection for different types of cuisine.  Wings are great with numerous flavors. Korean food was okay along with sushi selection. staff was friendly and the meal came pretty quickly with just the owners working.

name: Lashayle Dodson
text: I lived in Korea for four years. This place is not authentic and the people that run it are ghetto and trashy. Customer service is horrible as well. If you have a problem they will not address the issue but rather talk in circles.

name: Denard Castleberry
text: Great food an friendly staff.

name: V N
text: Their korean food (the bibimbap) is my favorite in Mobile! Please try the kim chi, I promise you'll be back for more.

name: Grandmaster
text: Definitely a different approach at this establishment. The bowl does not have a sign but it internally connected to the wing stop. The two restaurants share space in the dining room with a community soda machine. The food was fast and fresh. The owner finds his way into all three positions. Ordering, Cooking, and delivery into the dining room. I don't know how long he can do this but I know for sure he cannot do it forever. Good luck. We will return for more bubble tea with Boba!

name: JO
text: Delicious :)

name: Danielle Beasley
text: the employees were so friendly, the sushi chef even hooked my boyfriend & i up with free miso soups! the place was clean & not overcrowded or loud. & they have great prices for great food! definitely 5 stars!

name: Josh Walker
text: Very tasty, large portion, friendly staff.

name: april pasley
text: The food is amazing.  Takes a little bit to get your food.  I would suggest calling it in first.

text: Good prices, quantity, and taste. The only place to get Korean food in Mobile. It’s counter service so don’t expect table service. The staff is pleasant and quick.

name: Ant Hall
text: If you want delicious sushi and Korean cuisine, put Wild Bowl & Sushi's specialties in your mouth right now. Your taste buds and your wallet will thank you.

name: B B
text: Great food and owners are nice

name: Richard Jong
text: Preatty neat place. I believe it is the only place in Mobile to get Korean cuisine.

name: Dylan Saucida
text: Amazing place to go and absolutely wonderful food that could satisfy anyone's taste buds.

name: Laura Peacock
text: Best Korean bowls ever!! Super friendly and caring staff. I try something new every time I go and it's always DELICIOUS!!!👍👍👍

name: William Parker
text: I've ordered from this restaurant about 20 times. I think they have excellent poke bowls, and their pho + sushi special (half off any basic roll with any order of pho) is my go-to order. I feel their pho is much healthier than any other option in Mobile (which are few), although it benefits from adding a bit extra lime and fish sauce. The service here is also really respectable. The owner is very pleasant and accommodating, and he has often thrown in an extra small bowl of soup or a side for free just because I was a returning customer. Overall, I really enjoy having Wild Bowl and Sushi near me, and I commend them for their hard work and delicious food!

name: Samantha Howard
text: The Big Baddy sushi roll was delicious!! Everyone was pleasant and friendly.

name: juan rosales
text: I have not had good Korean food like this since Seoul , Korea. The customer service was great and very friendly.

name: G G
text:
The food and service is spectacular. The atmosphere is rather nice and very elegant. Well kept and well cleaned.Food is really good and the portions are very large so expect some take home after your full.
Only complaint is it's rather pricy on the dinner menu. Lunch prices seem fair but dinner prices jump up by almost 30%.Why not just keep the price the same for the same amount of food?

resp.text: Thank you for you great comment. Not easy but great suggestions,We will try to be better and someday earn your 5 star review!

name: Candy Bein
text: Tried takeout from here a few days ago. I don't like to judge places rated on their takeout because sometimes, takeout just isn't the same as going in person. I will say the food was pretty good, but not the best I have ever had. My steak was overcooked and the shrimp was pretty small. But all in all, it was good. I would be willing to try them in person. I think the food would probably be much better when fresh in front of you.

resp.text: We appreciate your feedback and look forward to having you back again we keep trying doing better win your 5 star review!

name: Lonnie Dulz
text: Of the  Japanese restaurants I've eaten at,  I like this one the best. Great food and friendly people.  My favourite off the menu is the NY strip  and shrimp dinner with noodles. 👍👍👍

name: LunaDev 64
text: Too much water in my salad, ginger dressing not the best, although I love ginger dressing just not theirs. Yum yum tasted off. Don't like that you have to add soup and salad, doesn't come with your meal.

name: Green Bean
text:
Food is frozen and heated. Bland. Problem with POS machine. Couldn't hear the girl taking our order. Edamame terrible. Ginger dressing in cup was decent when put on green salad from bag like you get at the grocery store.

Inside is nice and trendy, but when will Cullman start demanding good, fresh cooked food?

resp.text: We appreciate the time you took to write it. Want you to know that this not indicative of our standards. we have no way of contacting you,If you could please call or message our manager Megan 646-541-2669 she would love to speak with regarding your experience.

name: cindy elliott
text: It's not a bad place, just not what I expected. Have more of a "take out" atmosphere.

name: Toni Ash
text: Truly phenomenal. Cullman has needed a place like this. As affordable as the Hibachi Expresses of Huntsville, but feels more serious and professional.

name: Robbie Jean Bates
text: It's set up like any other take out place. You go in & order, sit down then they bring you your food. It was in take out containers though. Even our salads were in take out containers. The vegetables were really good, scallops too but small. Husband said the Filet mignon wasn't good.

resp.text: We apologize that this experience did not live up to you expectations. And want you to know we normally do much better. If available we are very gladly to replace for you the meal.

name: Alex Koehler
text: I've come here a few times and each dish has been delicious. The staff are so sweet and the restaurant is always clean, even while packed. Plus they have the best milk tea in town!!

name: Susan May
text: Great food. Employees are very attentive and sweet. Will go back!

name: May Payton
text: Friendly staff, great food. Definitely try the recommendations there! Staffs are very passionate and very friendly!

resp.text: Hello May,Glad you liked the food and service.Hope you come back soon.

name: George Hickox
text: Don’t believe the pictures in the window. That ain't what you get. Very and I do mean very disappointing food. Makes Panda Express look good!  Cullman STILL needs a good oriental restaurant!

name: Kaitlin Turner
text: I went on 4/6/21 and it was okay. They were out of pearls for the milk tea which was disappointing, but I got it without and the tea was good. I got the chicken and steak hibachi. The meat was cooked well, but a bit bland. Also, the noodles were like spaghetti noodles and they were completely covered in black pepper which wasn’t very appetizing. So for a plate, a milk tea, and an order of gyoza it was $26. It wasn’t really worth the price. I’ll probably go back for the tea, but that’s about it. 😕

text: What delicious food and beautiful presentation! A great place to share dinner with friends.

resp.text: Thank you for review us ! We don't think the fast food restaurant will ask you how would you like steak cooking . Behind the price is the guarantee of quality. Many customers say that our steak chicken seafood tastes very good. We just shorten the service process, but this does not affect our respect and seriousness with food.

text: The worst place I ever had the food was just bland and unseasoned. Seemed frozen, would not recommend to go and eat there.

resp.text: I'm sorry you think so, but we've noticed four comments like you, even punctuation marks. If it's a malicious smear, I think you're really wasting time. Osaka In the United States has over 30 years history, I'm sure cullman will see our respect for food and love for this community.

name: Jonathan Smith
text: Great food great friendly service & food was out fast will definitely be back

name: Maddie Berglund
text: A new restaurant in Cullman, I had high hopes specially because of the name “steakhouse”.  I was throughly disappointed. It’s set up like a fast food, but it is any but fast. Food came out twice wrong and was  super greasy.  The steak & shrimp was served in a weird liquid.  My milk tea tasted like detergent.  Over all very disappointing won’t be going back.

name: RAUL DOMINGUEZ-FLORES
text: Super delicious, everything was great, in special the mango carambola. Clean and very friendly.

name: Katie Barksdale
text: I was so sad that this place wasn't good. Or maybe they were having a really off day. We were so excited to have a new Japanese place in Cullman, but this place didn't match our expectations. The sushi burritos were a mixed review.  The California Roll one was pretty decent but the more expensive ones did not deliver. The hibachi was "ok". The rice was ok, the steak was good, but the veggies were cooked to death. The side salad was about five pieces of lettuce with a few carrots. The gyoza were fried all of the way, not pan fried like you would normally expect. The best thing we ate was the egg rolls. The drinks are self serve, so that was convenient. If you liked Mt. Fuji, don't go in thinking this is anything like it. More like, mall Japanese food. (I really hate saying that, but I just want to give you a heads up incase that is what you are not craving.) I will say the staff was very nice and the place was very clean.

resp.text: We apologize that this experience did not live up to you expectations. Thank you took time to feedback We confident that if you dined with us again you “it’s ok”would be  “it’s wonderful”.

name: tomorrow simmons
text: The people(staff) are really nice and the decorations are very nice so is the food

name: Olivia Rodgers

name: G G
text:
Best Japanese food locally and for miles.  High quality sushi. Decent price and great service.
Love the menu options. Drink prices are on par with other sit down places.

name: Mickey Berry
text: This place is one of our favorites! The service was very attentive without being overbearing. This time we ate at a table instead of at the hibachi grill, but the experience was just as delicious and relaxing. We have, without trying, tended to end up here at times of celebration or big moments in our lives. The food was perfect – steak, scallops, veggies, rice, soup, salad!

name: Helen Sturgeon
text: Fresh salads. The best ginger dressing I have ever tasted.

name: Geometryjosh 21
text: When you walk in, you know by the atmosphere that this establishment is very premium. The whole place is styled, of course, in a Japanese esque style, well executed too. The food is great! The soup they serve to you is great(I don't remember the name of it), and the sushi is amazing. It was my first time trying sushi and they made it a very good experience. If you haven't tried Japanese food that much or you're looking for something better that your typical Panda Express, this place has you covered. All at a cost though, as the prices here are a bit high, but not too much to run most off. This place is very deserving of 5 stars.

name: Cloey Robertson
text: The odds of getting something great are probably about 50/50. The shumai and miso soup were delicious, but the salad with ginger dressing was definitely lacking in flavor. The Spicy Tuna Roll and the Spicy Yellowtail Roll were rich and full, but the Eel Roll had a bit too much avocado and the Alabama Roll had a bit too much cucumber, and absolutely needs the sauce it comes with. The Fire House Roll was creamy, yet a tad spicy. It needed the extra kick from wasabi, however. A bit more balance, punch, and diversity and this place would be wonderful.

name: Wendy Batchelor
text: Food is so good, I wish you guys would open back up.

name: Johnathan Brown
text: This place is great. Great atmosphere with very helpful staff and amazing sushi

name: Kimberly Hogan
text: This is my favorite sushi restaurant. The food is fantastic and the prices aren't bad.

name: Syd Savage
text:
The food is always amazing , and I could probably drink their ginger dressing. Yeah the service isn’t amazing but I go for the food not the service.
I don’t really understand people saying it’s “too pricey” considering it’s cheaper than most restaurants like it and definitely cheaper than other restaurants.

name: Nick Harbison
text: Some of the best sushi I've ever had.

name: Jim Powell
text: Good Japanese food at a reasonable price. They have good sushi and hibachi dishes. The hibachi is not cooked in front of you on an open grill. Go to Ninja Japanese Steakhouse if you want the experience but go here if you want the same food faster/cheaper.

I understand from my friend that this is not a usual server,  and not a usual experience. Sashimi seems to be very fresh but rolls often have more filler than protein. Also, sushi bar is pretty sloooow. Hibachi food is generally very quick .Don't come for the service, come for the food!

We started off with some miso soup (I've had better, I've had worse) and salad. We tried various rolls: OMG roll (loved it), spicy crab roll (loved it) spicy salmon roll (it's like crispy salmon mixed with raw salmon, not a big fan) and a few of the sushi options via the shogun's choice. I got the salmon, tuna, and yellow fin. Could you be any more generic? Afterwards we got two eel sushi which were great.

text: I've never had a bad experience here. Even my take out order was done right. My only complaint is the teriyaki chicken is always a bit tougher than I prefer, yet it's still good! My son insisted we give them a 5 because our overall service (&quality) made his 5 star rating combine with my 4.5 star average to 5 stars rounded up! ;) I've only ever eaten here with him so I think this a fair rating considering our shared experience.

text: I am from out of town. I came here with my child after a doctor appointment. The server was EXTREMELY RUDE! After my child almost got hit in the head with a painting they had hanging up with thumb tacks, the server asked us if  we could move to a table.  We asked why and he stated "I just don't want anything spilled on the booth". Not sure why that mattered. The entire experience was terrible and they were just rude the entire time! I will not be back. NOT kid or family friendly!

name: Mike Bauer
text: Horrible!  The place is dirty. The service is slow even when you are the only customer in the restaurant.      Rice was sticky (old?).   Fish was old tasting.   Empty beer bottles lining the shelf in front to the mirror are considered decoration.  Mirror is visibly dirty.   Waiter was clueless.    I really wish this place was good since it is just down the street.   I will not go back. Go to Fuji.

name: Ashley Hudson
text: Food is great -- staff are always very nice. Decent prices. Did I mention it's BYOB?! 😄

name: Tom Snead
text: Tiki lamps lined the parking lot as we arrived and Fur Elise greeted us as we approached the entrance.  The seared tuna appetizer was outstanding and a good value.  The sushi roll was okay but it could have been my selection.  The deluxe seaweed salad was good but small portioned.  The hibachi shrimp and chicken with mixed vegetables was really good and the miso was par. - Overall, good food and atmosphere.

name: Hope3344
text: I hate to give this place such a low score because the service was great but the food was absolutely terrible.  I go to Sakura back home and this place is nothing like it. It is a small place so the hibachi dinners are cooked in the back in the kitchen, not in front of you. The sushi was so so.  very disappointed

name: Reztierk Sukram
text: I ate here the first time and it was a good experience having some type of teriyaki cooked dish. Next, I had sushi here. The fish was not cold and the wasabi was brown and discolored from being left out for too long. What was worse, I had food poisoning for two days after. I probably should have reported them to the health department. Very disappointed. When you eat sushi, it's important to go to a reputable restaurant...after all, you are eating uncooked meat.

name: Garrett Hestla
text: Great! Loved it! Bring your own wine

text: Gyoza and ramen were delicious. Staff were very friendly and food arrived quickly.

name: The Changeling 13
text: Amazing food! It's rare to find good authentic good, whether it's American or true Asian cuisine. They also have a grocer attached to the restaurant for all your cooking needs if you need something  that you can't find elsewhere. Absolutely recommend this place to anyone and everyone! They don't get much business so please stop by and give it a try if your interested.

name: Jessica Hidalgo
text: Love, love, love the staff/owners. Genuine family owned & operated, the moment you first walk in, they treat you like their family. The artwork around the restaurant is captivating, there’s art everywhere you look and lots of little details to appreciate. Their food is great, every time - definitely recommend the spicy Japanese curry. Quaint little place, you won’t leave without a smile.

text: They are a smile menu but the food an service is amazing

text: Kind people and great Artwork. Picture is of the Hot Pot Katsu.  It was delicious!  My Husband and son enjoyed the Ramen and Soba.  This is a must try!

text: I’ve been to MANY ramen shops and this was hands down the WORST and most unauthentic ramen I’ve ever had in a restaurant, it tastes and smells like top ramen and I could’ve made better top ramen than that at home. I couldn’t even eat my food I was so upset.

name: Tabytha Cribb
text: amazing service and food. worth every penny

name: Theron Cameron
text: A very small restaurant with great food. I had their fried dumplings and ramen, and both were excellent. The dumplings were crispy but still soft and perfectly made. I chose the pork ramen and the pork was fried and although it was in the ramen managed to still have a slight crispness to it. The ramen was slightly spicy at my request, but if you’re sensitive to spice I would recommend asking for no spice. I always enjoy places that pride themselves in their food and this is certainly one of them.

text: Pork Ramen was amazing!

text: some of the worst food and service we've ever gotten

name: James Parsons
text: great food

name: Nikeeta FoxFive
text: Food was great as usually this is one if my favorite hibachi spots. I ordered the steak option and it was delicious seasoned well. Greg ordered the chicken and shrimp also delicious. We had soup and salad and onion soup. Jackie hot 2 types of sushi it was beautiful and colorful and good.. The tea was sweet. We didn't have a super long wait time, but when we left the wait was growing. Our cook was great and entertaining and engaging which made the dinner more fun!

name: Sean White
text: Waiting for over an hour after reservation for staff to seat even though we had the late arrivals food order for a birthday. The staff continued to change stories of why they won't seat us. The staff was immature and belittling to us. They lied to the Chef which told us he would not serve us for what ever they said. We ended up leaving without being served after an hour and a half of horrible treatment which ruined a birthday dinner.

name: Emily Church
text: My boyfriend and I have been here multiple times within the last two months. Always great service and great food! We have also started to come in to buy the salad dressing because it’s THAT tasty. It’s a little pricey, but it will do for now until I can make my own version! :)

name: Leigh Dudley
text: Love this place! Love the food! Blasting Rap music, no thank you. I will not be back!

name: Erin Hodgson
text: Delicious food and an entertaining chef. I had the scallops, which were cooked and seasoned perfectly. Together with the fried rice, soup, salad, grilled veggies (broccoli, mushrooms, zucchini, onions, and carrots), and cabbage it was more than enough for dinner tonight and lunch tomorrow.

name: allen folds
text: Great place to eat just one thing I didn't like is the fact even if you have more than 5 to 6 people and the checks are separate your still charged a 20% service charge on each check. To me that wrong and taking advantage of people. I could understand better if it was on all one check but it was not.

name: CRiNkLe CRuNgLe
text: Went here with my mom on my birthday and the food was great like always. My one and only problem is that they usually put too much dressing on their salads, not too much of a big deal tho. Service from our waitress Amanda was also excellent. Would definitely recommend the hibachi chicken.

name: Amazon Account
text: They did a great job of cooking the food and portioning with everyone at our table. My compliant is that their menu prices are not what they charge. Its not a big amount (11.99 -vs- the 12.99 they charged and every other thing we ordered was wrong) . Having correct menu prices or at the very least informing customers they have changed prices  would be an expected common courtesy.  We will not be back for a very long time, if at all.

name: Joshua Cleveland
text: I sat at the sushi bar and had some good banter with the chef, who was extremely funny! My friend and I had a great time and the sushi was so good! The wait time was quick, however service was a little slow, but I can account that to how busy they were.

text: Service is always great. They always treat my boys great. Food is awesome! Love love the rice.

name: Sandi Hagan
text: The man that cooked the food was great. Very talented, entertaining, and an excellent cook. He's a keeper.

name: Sierrha Smith
text: I love this place everytime we go! They had gotten some more cooks and they are very personable which males the whole experience.

name: Phillip Edwards
text: I had the shrimp with rice and my wife had steak and rice. Both of us felt the rice was too dry. The shrimp was amazing but my wife's steak was a bit hard. The service there was fast and very friendly, we just didn't want to wait 30 minutes for a seat in front of the chef

name: Marissa Yoshikawa
text:
For our visit on 1/15/21

The star is only for the server, chef, and bar manager. It took over an hour to get seated, we had to wait for the entire party to be here. I understand it was busy and there were a lot of customers, but the hostess’ attitude was negative with our party from the very start. Several in our party observed how the hostess interacted with the party next to us compared to how she interacted with our party. She was smiling and talking with the other party, they had their menus and drinks ordered before us even though we were at our table first. We sat without menus or drinks for 20 min before we had to ask for them several times. The hostess then proceeded to throw our menus on our plates, all the while dropping some on the floor then continuing to throw them on our plates. We held our hand out when she was throwing the menus so she could give it to us instead, but went out of her way to throw them instead. Then, I had to wait 20 min for my drink, asking multiple times. The chef and food were great! When asked to speak to the manager, we were directed to the bar manager because apparently the restaurant manager refused to speak with us. Thank you to the BAR manager and server for hearing our concerns and complaints!

name: trish
text: Was good. The guy at the grill lacked the skill to keep our attention. But the food was good.

name: Destiny Miles
text: Hands down the best Japanese restaurant in Columbus, GA! Sit at the bar with Christian one of the best and while you’re at it try one of her speciality drinks. You won’t regret it!

name: tamikka lasenbery
text: Best ever. For it been mt first time will definitely go again

name: Justin Opel
text:
Cross contamination is definitely a real thing here.
Good thing I don't mind raw product.

Picture is of the shrimp and scallop untouched.

name: Kayla Yanez
text:
Last night we wanted to celebrate my husband's birthday. it was a Saturday, so I called early and made reservations for 12 people at 6pm. The girl on the phone asked if we wanted a grill, and I asked if we could fit 12 people at a grill, she said yes.
We arrive just before 6 and let them know we are waiting on 2 people from our party, as they wouldn't seat us until everyone arrived. No problem, that's on us. They arrive within 10 minutes and we let the host know we're good to go. She says they're just waiting on a table to be cleared. We wait 20 minutes outside and check back. The 3 hosts are arguing with each other and no one seems to know what is going on. there are two open grills, but they are waiting on a party to finish eating to seat us there. We wait another 20 minutes, and are finally seated. The grill they take us to is not set for 12, and the other side of it hasn't been cleared. We grab some extra chairs and plates ourselves, and wait again. 15 minutes goes by and we still haven't been approached by anyone for drinks or anything. I go to the counter and ask if we even have a waitress. She asks, "a waitress? let me go check". I sit back down at our table. Another 10 minutes goes by. at this point we called a restaurant down the street to see if they could quickly accommodate us and they said to come on over. As we are leaving, a member in our party asked to speak to a manager. THEY REFUSED TO COME OUT AND TALK TO US! They said they didn't want to deal with it. I'm sorry, but are you Freaking kidding me!? You lost out on a $800+ tab for the night We waited well over an hour past our reservation time and had the WORST service imaginable. I felt embarrassed for even making our friends deal with all of that. I will never give this place my business again. Absolutely shameful.

name: Carlos Walton
text: Food is delicious...staff is amazing and our cook kept us entertained..

name: Lindsay Galloway
text: Hands down my favorite restaurant in town! The owners are pretty cool too!

name: JBX three
text:
Last few years have been amazing , and the chefs here are hilarious and crafty with a spatula

I'll be moving away soon but this is one place I will always remember about Columbus

text: Favorite date night dinner spot. The food and service is always AMAZING!

name: Peytanne McQuinn
text: Complete hit or miss. Today, I came in and got sushi salad and soup to go. I opened my salad, it was tiny, brown and soggy. I asked the lady if there was a spoon and she assured me there was.. but there wasn’t. So I can’t eat my soup since I am somewhere without any silverware. They forgot my coke so I had to return back in for it. This meal was $25. That is enough money to have fresh lettuce at least. I also had to peel off the toppings of my sushi because it didn’t look right. I order the same thing every time and this was the first time I was scared to eat it. I ate a couple of pieces and threw the rest away- I didn’t feel well after eating it so I’m glad I only had a couple of pieces. Pretty bummed out about my experience today. Not sure I’ll be back- at least for a while or until someone reaches out to resolve the issue

text: Food was good. It was busy and of course with it being Japanese, you sit at tables with other people. There were 5 of us seated with 2 other families of 2. Not socially distanced.

text: Wait time was over an hour, even after being told it would be 45 minutes.  Once seated, it was another 15 to 20 minutes before the soup and salad was served. My Hollywood sushi roll, the cream cheese and avacado over powered the crab...everyone else seemed okay with their meal

The hostess was rude and took twenty minutes to bring the menus. It was another twenty minutes to get drinks and we had to ask multiple times. They would only allow us to speak to the bar manager. Then to top it off they charged my card twice for the same order and told me to call my bank to dispute the charge instead of refunding it.

text: They do NOT have good fried rice. Everything is great except the fried rice 😭 Mikata and Shogun do rice way better.

I dont normally leave reviews but it was bad

text: So good! Everyone loved the food. We got big plates so everyone could share from each because my kids are like me and want to try everything. Staff was super friendly. The atmosphere is nice and clean. The only complaint, which I guess isn't really a complaint, but it is a bit pricey.

text: Nice atmosphere, fun, plentiful. But, don't order the grill chicken unless you like it though and hard. And the side salad looks like soup; nothing but lettuce, no toppings.

text: It was great place to eat kinda expensive but the service was great so I didn't mind playing the price

text: Best service. Fav restaurant

text: We chose to sit at a table where our food came from the kitchen and not from someone cooking it right in front of us. I'd suggest getting the salad dressing on the side for mine and my husbands were drenched in salad dressing.  My chicken and rice was pretty good,  the stir fry vegetables were way over cooked though. 3 stars.

name: Simon Strothers
text: Was able to reserve a table for my sons birthday, no wait. Food was good would go back again. Son really enjoyed his dinner.

name: Bae Arthur
text: Grill chef slipped me some chicken on the DL even though i didn't order it, thanks man

name: Sarah Parker
text: Vivian is hands down the best server I’ve ever had at any restaurant EVER. She’s so sweet and attentive. The food was great and we will be back hopefully when Vivian is working. Thank you for such incredible service!!!!

name: Anthony Wright
text: Hands down one of my favorite restaurants in Columbus Georigia! If you want cheaper prices try going at lunch time!! You get more food for your buck, I promise !! Ask for extra rice !!

name: RK Jain
text: Always a pleasure, good staff. Good drinks and sushi. Amazing hibachi experience. Lots of leftovers for the following morning

name: Christopher Pinson
text: Love this place, great food! Great atmosphere! One of my favorites

name: Malcolm Hatcher
text: This time of year it’s hot any way but we had a booth up next to the open grill and it seemed way to hot! Our order was wrong- they made it right very quick and it was very good- I did mention the heat and they agreed with me but didn’t seem to do anything about it. My and my friend ate here recently and it was very good! We did not get hibachi style food, only sushi. We each got three different types of sushi and they were all delicious!! The server was very sweet and explained each roll to us. The restaurant was clean and had a very “zen-ful” atmosphere. We will definitely come back, and get hibachi next time!! Great place for couples or friends. Good place to eat in Columbus!!

name: Antoinetta Scott
text: Food was good but i only got three shrimp and pieces of steak. I thought i was getting my money worth.

name: TMBaby Jay
text: I totaly loved it.  It was amazing and our chef was excellent😘

name: Vanessa Vivas
text:
We always go to FUJI to celebrate birthdays. With covid, they had to cancel their big wedding so we decided FUJI would be perfect. They catered my brother’s wedding on 10/10 and let me tell you. Everything was perfect and delicious. I was super stressed out when I arrived to pick up the food and everyone there was so nice. Millie took the order initially and I increased the number of people a week later. She also texted me a few days before to confirm. When I got there, I was confused as to how many people were eating and Millie confirmed the text message. They even offered to add more rice. It was more than enough food.

10/10 definitely recommend

name: Tara Hood
text: One of my favorite Japanese steak houses. We always eat at the grill because its such a fun, interactive experience. Their lunch prices are cheap 10-11 per person on average. That doubles around dinner time but so does the food portions. They always have drink specials! There is a sushi bar, private room you can rent, full bar and additional seating not at the grills. Great for a family day or date night.

name: Dillon Medlin
text: Food was ok nothing great but the plate was very small on my Togo order and over priced in my opinion that's why I only left two stars

name: Angela Angela
text: I went to Fuji's Steakhouse one of my most favorite restaurant for lunch take out today. And I was totally taking back by the customer service I received. I asked a couple of questions concerning the my lunch prices. I was told rudely by the young lady who checked me out (her response could've been better). She's NOT the one who set the prices & doesn't make the prices. So, I informed her that was rude to say to me as the consumer. Her response was I thought I was being nice. Therefore, she proceeded with her rudeness and then TOSS my food to me on the counter. Then she proceeded to help the next person as those I wasn't still standing there. Her manager walks up to her as I started walking away she proceeded to discuss with him VERY LOUDLY about her transaction with me & five other customers listening to her stating I was rude by correcting her from speaking to me the way she did. At this point I just motion for him to come toward me to discuss this matter. The manger older gentlemen came to me after she angrily expressed herself in front of everyone. Once he came to, before I could get my first sentence out he was already in a dismissive mode and would not look at me the whole time when I was talking so it appeared as though he wasn't listening so, when I asked him was he listening to me he said he doesn't have to look at me to hear me talk & he could see what she said about me, and then stated I was being rude towards him by asking him was he listening. He walked away without even hearing me out telling me thank you for your purchase goodbye he was very dismissive and unprofessional. It was as though, I was stereotyped and treated accordingly from the beginning to the end.

name: Lindy Moore
text: They are NOT social distancing in the front at all. Many people were crowded in the waiting areas WITHOUT masks. I cannot speak for other areas, as I only ordered takeout. They are listed as having curbside, but when I called upon arrival (multiple times) the phone was off the hook forcing me to go into the restaurant. The employee I encountered wasn’t wearing a mask at first, appeared to be sick, and was rude.

name: Mike Okeefe
text: Love coming here for fresh sushi or the samurai special.  The service is always on point and very friendly. Great atmosphere for a date or the family.

text: Absolutely worst service ever. Waited over 1hr to sit down even though we had a reservation. Absolutely no one came to our table after sitting for 15-20 min . When someone from our table asked to speak to a manager they refused to even talk to us ! The kicker to this review is they was slap empty! This place won’t last long with the management staff they have . As we was walking out side two of there waitresses was out side crying over drama in the parking lot. Highly recommend not going here!

Absolutely spot on meat, the rice is exceptional, if you choose to seat at a table the presentation of the plate is exemplary, to opt in for the grill is to have a fun time with super friendly chefs and their list of jokes and tricks. For the price, the experience is absolutely worth it.

name: Karen Jaramillo
text: Rainbow Roll:   The sushi and sashimi was amazing!  The waitress Amanda I believe was her name, was great. The miso soup, was terrible and so was the unsweet tea.  The unsweet tea was very watered down, it didn’t even taste like tea.   The miso soup had an unusual taste to it and it was chocolate brown in color vs. the cloudy clear that I am accustomed to.    I would go back for the sushi and sashimi.

name: June Suggs
text: Wonderful Experience & the food was Plentiful & Delicious

name: Elizabeth Camacho
text:
BEWARE!
We got -to go- on Sunday. My ticket was $44.28. (2 meals and a extra soup.) checked my bank Monday morning and they were charging me over $61!!! I immediately call Fuji to see what happened. After talking to multiple staff claiming to all be "managers" I was told that they "didn't know what to do but the owner would call me back." It's now Wednesday and I still haven't received a call back. I did receive a private email from a supposed "family" member of the owner. He proceeded to call me names, ask me questions about my order, belittle me and say over and over how they "would never do that".This person does not even work at the restaurant! I am now having to dispute the charges with my bank (who is being very helpful). Just sad that Fuji decided to handle a simple situation so horribly. The food is good but this experience was too much! BEWARE and keep your receipts!

name: Ashleigh Schneider
text: To the lady that stared, not appreciated. My eyes hurt from looking back.

text: Food was very tasty very reasonably and the service was excellent

name: Shelby Harper
text: First time here tonight, I walked in and  made a pretty large to-go order. The hostess was the nicest, most caring, and proficient hostess I have met. She made sure all my extra sauces were in the bags, the food was correct, and just had the best attitude. I have worked in the food industry for close to 10 years and I can honestly say I would hire her in a heartbeat if I had my own restaurant.  The food was the most tender, tasteful food my family has had, and this is coming from a family who’s favorite cuisine is oriental foods. The restaurant was extremely clean and well decorated on the inside. I would highly recommend to any and everyone!!!

text: Me and my wife went here by chance and we were not disappoint at all. We were really impressed with the decor and the service. We visited two days in a row. We had sushi, soup, and sake. I tried the pink Godzilla on my first visit and the Scooby doo on my second visit. Sky is the sushi chef and his rolls are industry worthy. When we head back to Alabama they will see us again. Loved it.

text: The food is always great as well as the staff.  My son had a blast watching his food be cooked and the chef kept him entertained.  I can easily see myself becoming a regular here.  Yum yum!

name: Melody Mantooth
text: My husband and I decided to sit at the sushi bar today and it was a great choice! We normally eat at the grill because the food is great there as well. However, we wanted to do something different. The sushi bar was amazing and we had an amazing sushi chef to make recommendations and keep us company. We will definitely be back.

name: Tony S
text: Food every good.  Friendly service

name: kathy Thompson
text: First time eating out post covid-19.....

name: David Hampton
text: Staff was slacking. Failed to social distance guests and overall lack of safety precautions. Only 4 of maybe 10 servers were wearing masks

name: Cynthia Austin
text: Food not prepared as ordered. Server was nice but she has only been serving 4 weeks. She was only given basics not pointers to help her be a better server and get better tips

name: Kera Doggins
text: This is my favorite place to get Japanese food. It is also my childhood and I'm happy that I got to go here even though I moved.

name: Rifia Hambali
text:
Been a nice restaurant in town.
Located in veterans pkwy.
.
My favorite appetizer is karashi conch
And salmon tataki.
.
Hibachi grill scallops or salmon.
Not so much for filet or shrimp.
.
Their fried rice is gooood..
.
Request Sae to be your server if you come here 😉. He makes your dinner experience different.

text: My son spent his birthday here. Seems to be a great place. He enjoyed.

name: Alan Dandorf
text: Good sushi and good prices.  Would recommend.

name: Lasaundra Robinson
text: It was great.....  I'm so full....

name: Amber Fielding
text: Always delicious, always pleasant service.  The little salads are so so good.  I would kill for that  dressing.  Try the eel roll and the calamari hibachi if you want something different.

name: Allison Wunderbread
text: After our waiter finally got drinks to us he left for probably 20 min we watched him push around the cart of dishes hopefully washed his hands but noticed he didn’t. My sushi finally came out with no cream cheese so he took it to the sushi bar and it came back busted open hard to handle with chopsticks without falling apart because the cream cheese was so filled in there. Had to take some out cos it was all I tasted. SUPER diluted soy when you pour it soy falls out of bottom of lid (we got one from another table did the same thing) salad was soggy it was just really not good we will not go there again we love sushi and what not at least we know where not to go.

name: Jay Maley
text: Daniellla is the best!  Our second visit at the bar and always a joy to sit and chat with her. Great company and cold drinks. Thank you for a great night!  See you next time!

name: ETB 2106
text: Kyle is a great Chef... we always enjoy it when he is our chef. The food is great. The service is excellent.  I love this place.

name: Tabby Champion (Tabby)
text: We always enjoy the grill!

name: bob stanfield
text: Food is always great. If you sit at the grill be ready to be impressed with a show the first and second time you go. On the third time you realize that the show never changes. Regardless of that it is still fun to bring other people to and watch reactions. The bar makes some basic mixed drinks but nothing note worthy.

name: Edgar Hernandez
text: Love it braj

name: Duane Layfield
text: Good food..real good sushi.. service is pretty good.. but aspect to pay at least $20 per person..but worth the money to me..

name: Diego Pedraza
text: Great place to always visit. The people are very personal! They remembered me and my family! Great food and real chefs who know how to cook. Don't get me started on the sushi. It was absolutely amazing!!!!! 🤩🤩

name: Lloyd French
text: Enjoyed the sushi I had. Place is larger than I expected too!!

name: Famous Nate
text: One of my favorites, its now kinda standard in the US to go to a Japanese steakhouse. But these guys do a good job and serve good size portions.

name: S M
text: Bento box was trash. A mouse ran across the floor. Waited an hour and 45 min for our food. When the manager came over I said comp the food and put the drinks on the ticket so I can leave a tip.  He gave us a 10% discount, how generous. He also tried to blame the staff after telling me he was “laying down in the back office and if there was a problem they should have gone to (him)”.  Will never go back.

I usually sit around the grill with family but order sushi. The sushi here is often overlooked but is Very Good. I wish cooking display was MORE individual.

text: Awesome! The cook was very interactive with the group and played with the kids the whole time. My kids are still talking about it lol. We will definitely go back.

text: Great service and food

name: Raymond Cook
text:
M
Normally I don't have a problem with the service at this restaurant..Today was different. First my to go order was incomplete and instead of the young lady up front trying to make things right,  she shows no concern,  very nonchalant and never got the order correct. A gentleman tried to help but his response was that he didn't take the order. Not a good day. Left with an incomplete inaccurate ordrr.

name: Tricia Kvidt
text: This was the worse experience ever. I would recommend new management.  Seem like everyone was in a twilight zone. manager was awful, not customer oriented at all. I would give this place a negative 100...

text: It's fun and the Food is great. But here's my thing. You feel alittle rushed. The restaurant is gorgeous!! But if you had one hibachi, you had them all.

text:
Great Japanese Restaurant
A very nice show the Chef puts on.  So much rich food. A little pricey at night, but they have lunch specials.

text: Service and food were very good. I would give it 5 stars if the a/c worked properly. Incredibly hot in the restaurant. Couldn't wait to get outside.

text: Food was good and service was pleasant. I would recommend

text:
CALL AHEAD FOR SEATING:
should say closed to public is you cant serve guest because you over booked parties!  Good news they did say Shogun is really good!

name: Leviticus Jenkins
text: Good customer service best Hibachi place in Columbus that I have visited. Plan to go visit the islands that most of the servers are from. Every cook does not cook as well the very tall gentleman with a missing tooth is one of the best cooks there. Fried rice tastes way better cooked on the grill top then in the back so don't order it to go.

name: Zeb Austin
text: Great food!   Staff is always pleasant.

name: Alex Hdz
text: Had seen this place many times while driving by but never gave it a chance since yesterday. Every single thing I hate there was so delicious.  Even the salad was so good their dressing and the yum-yum sauce were amazing.  If you dont know what to order from sushi bar I recommend you try The Boston, We had the steak and chicken and steak was definitely made to order (medium).  You get lots of food so come eat on empty stomach or take home for a other meal.  Place could use a face lift but other than that the food was amazing.

name: Colin E
text: Definitely one of the tastiest adventures Columbus has to offer.

name: Tonya Catrett
text: Food and atmosphere is nice.  Everyone is so nice

name: Randal Roberts
text: Fuji is an enjoyable place to have a good hibachi bite. Their food is cooked by expert chefs with considerable tenure, and it is generally seasoned very well. Seating can be a bit cramped, but sitting with strangers is an essential part of the experience. Overall, portions could be a bit larger, but the experience is always a good one.

name: Try Smarter Tuesday
text: The taste of the food was fresh and very savoring. The cook was extremely fun and very entertaining. We had an outstanding evening there and probably one of the best nights we had in a few months. This is our top 5 spots to eat it all time. Highly recommend you go and be ready to be entertained.

name: David Rodgers
text: Food and service was excellent just like I expected! Never a disappointed customer, thanks for the great dinner and customer service

name: Misty Kearney
text: Angelique was a perfect server!  The food is consistently delicious! Count on being glad you went!

name: Brendan Owen
text: Freaking delicious. The hibachi chef cooks it on front of you, they put on a bit of a show, the food is fantastic. I've been twice in the last month and will probably go again within the next few weeks.

name: Mark Pettit
text: Food is always cooked to order. Staff are always customer oriented. The restaurant is always clean. Good atmosphere.

name: The Grimes Family
text: Great food. I enjoy watching the chef cook in front of us. Family-friendly.

name: Brandon Dean
text: I don't know what was worse, the food or the service. Not busy at all, but took a very long time to even place our order and even longer to get it. When the food did arrive, everything was overcooked and bland. I hope the hibachi grill stuff is better, because the rest of the menu is not worth it at all. My advice, go to one of the other 10 Japanese steakhouses in town.

name: Arthur Chambers
text: Good as hell

name: April Gilbert
text: Our Hibachi chef was awesome! Food was delicious! We will be going back....loved it!!

name: Michaelob Bruno
text: My shorty like going here but it taste just like the buffet we could've went to

name: Leslie Bell
text: Ordered my food to go... AWESOME service and incredible food. My portions were so large, I have lunch tomorrow! The sushi and shashimi we're amazingly fresh and beautiful. Highly recommend ❣️

name: Robert Larson
text: Great show and great food!

name: Petina Yeldell
text: Everything was great, the food and our server Richard! We sat at the booth. Thank goodness, because the chefs at the grills weren't entertaining this morning. We ordered the lunch specials and two different sushi rolls. We will definitely be returning.

name: Fredarius Marshall. h
text: The food here us delicious. They give you a great deal of food when its served so if you are a big guy like myself or just have a good appetite this is your spot lolz.

name: D Lewis
text: Hair was in my food.  And like so many others during this pandemic, I ordered takeout.  So therefore I did not know that hair was in my food sir!!!!  Thanks for the manager who stated there was nothing he could do about it.  I will not be returning!

name: James Sports
text: My favorite place to eat. Staff is really friendly, food is AMAZING!  I had my first sushi for my birthday...the waiter dodnt make a big deal outta my birthday cause I didn't want a big deal deal made, but he brought me some desert for free and sang me happy birthday. GREAT PLACE!

name: Joses Gary
text: Excellent service wonderful food. I absolutely loved the chef "RICE RICE BABY"

name: John Miller
text: If you go here, get the grill experience. It's a good performance with even better food. The people that make it in front of you definitely make it better than the people in the back.

name: Christine Warren
text: This is mine and my husband's favorite place to eat. Whether we're by ourselves or with our 3 children. Last night we took our 3 year old daughter there for the very first time and she LOVED IT! The chef paid special attention to her and made the night so special for all of us.  The food is always amazing, the Sushi is to die for, and the friendly staff and entertaining chefs are incredible!

name: Mr. James
text: I have eaten at this place since it was built, me and my family have became personal friends with some of the staff. Great price for lunch or dinner, nice people clean and great food.

name: Alberto Montoto
text: It's good

name: Kimberlee Metcalfe
text: Food was great, chef was great however or waiter couldn't keep up with our bills. He did not give me my chance which was over $10 and even misplaced my daughters bill and payment. We've always had amazing service all the way around until this time.

name: Zach Lawson
text: Very friendly staff and great food. Great place to have a family dinner

name: Ray Barcinas
text: Once again just hands down a great evening spent at Fuji steak house!! Atmosphere was exquisite, we were greeted with the utmost respect!! But the best part of it all is Chef Kyle on deck from the entertainment and on point skills and preparation for the food we were about to devour!! If there were more stars on this app I’d give it all to him!! Till next time again guys!! Pure awesomness!!

name: Charles Moudy
text: Enjoyed the grill seat. Will enjoy the porcelain seat later.

name: Brandy Finley
text: Love this place!

name: Joshua Norris
text: The food was delicious, but the service was even better. The waiter was very knowledgeable of the menu and was able to recommend his opinion on the food when we were stumped between two dishes. He was also very entertaining to my 8 and 4 year old boys. I highly recommend checking this place out, but ensure you check they're hours of operation before showing up in between lunch and dinner when they are closed momentarily. Two thumbs way up!

name: Vernon Carswell Jr
text: It was similar to Thanksgiving. You really want to try EVERYTHING, but can't. You eat on the doggy bag until you tired of looking at it every time you open the fridge. I got brave and ordered double fried rice. ItsI impossible to eat that much food. Best Habatchi Chefs in area.

name: Ross Wilcoxon
text: I eat my steak and say yummmmmmmm great Service hilarious people

name: Antwan Benton
text: Slow but amazing food and experience

name: Jamie Stien
text: Great place!  LARGE portions . . .so you get what you pay for.  The staff and chefs are funny and go out of their way to make you comfortable!

name: Cecelia Dixie
text: This place was very professional, and helped us with a graduation party of 30. That is a lot of people to serve, and we felt that it was done very well!! They sat us all together, and made sure to check on us regularly. I gave them 4 instead of 5 stars because they were short a couple of cooks, and we had to wait a little while to eat; however, when they came, the food was good, and everyone was happy with the service, and this selection after graduation.

name: B L Y N K r6
text: It has some really good food except the craw fish. I was able to try sushi for the furst time too.

name: Tonya Pernell

name: Annie Grimes

name: Bos Johnson

text: Good Family fun is what we had a Fuji Japanese Steakhouse! Our waiter and Chef was hilarious! The food was good. We had a great experience at this restaurant

name: Christina Goodwin
text: Take out meals are not as good as dine in ones. Everything we bought lacked flavor and was greasy.

name: latoya arrington
text: I absolutely love this place....the vibes, atmosphere all that is awesome

name: Cindy Taylor
text: I enjoyed my birthday dinner here.  We came on a Saturday evening and it was packed.  We were seated within 15 minutes.  Food was excellent.  Our server Joy was great.  Great attitude and great service.  She even brought me birthday dessert.  Very unexpected and much appreciated.

name: Michael Sjostrom
text: Great food and great portions!  It had been a long time since previously dinning there as portions had gotten a bit skimpy.  We were pleasantly surprised to see it return to the great experience we had in the past.  And both the chef and waitress were fantastic!

name: Brent Waddell
text:
We called ahead and was told they were open til 9
We get there at 20 mins til and was told they are closed we drove an hour to eat there very disappointed I will be taking my buisness elsewhere

name: Sandra Richeson
text: I thought was a nice place to try but we order my daughter's food first so she didn't have to wait for us and unfortunately our food arrived first and she was waiting for some time. After ate there our stomachs weren't good. We won't come back!

name: Wendylee Hall
text: It's fun, romantic,  and the food is always fantastic!

name: Brooke Stewart
text: Always the best place in town for hibachi. Entertaining and friendly staff and delicious food!

name: Janet Charters
text: Had a great Christmas lunch there with co-workers. The waiter and chef were both entertaining. A clean friendly atmosphere.

name: mike green
text: This place has steadily gone down hill. Several months ago we said it was our last time but decided to give it another try. We were welcomed at the front door with unsightly signs about the bathroom and if are seated you are charged if you dont eat. Once inside, we were greated by two hostess. One took us to an empty grill and said someone would be with us. As she took us to the table I noticed that the place wasn't very clean and stepped over 2 paper napkins laying on the floor which means the hostess stepped over them too. After seating I noticed the grill wasn't very clean either and started looking around and noticed  other napkins and straws laying on the floor. I proceed to set there another 4-5 minutes watching several employees walk by the trash. I understand if a place is busy but the was 430 on a Saturday with one grill seated and more than enough employees standing around doing nothing. We got up and left and will not be back.

name: Bruce Stansbury
text: Fantastic quality food.  Great service.  Fabulous entertainment by the table chefs.  The eel is delicious as well as the call onvenrional chicken and steak meals.

name: Kaché Garcia
text: Usually I wait until the 3rd or 4th time to review any place, but MY GOODNESS, my husband and I's experience was amazing! We were promptly seated by our lovely hostess; Sae was our wonderful and gracious server and made some amazing sushi recommendations; all the sushi, our starter soup and salad and drinks were made and presented to perfection! So flavorful, well prepared and there was this wasabi sauce-y'all. Stop by and treat yourself(selves)! We saw families enjoying their meals while laughing with their chefs, the people at the bar were having fun, servers were all friendly regardless as to whether or not they were helping your table; a true experience! We will most definitely be back the next time our sushi craving kicks in and I cannot wait! Hope to see you there! Thanks again, Sae!

name: Cynthia Wright
text: The demonstration by the chief was spectacular! Food was good and service was quick and right on time.

name: Mandy Vega
text: I have been here a few times, but after tonight I needed to leave a review! Our chef Kyle was great. He was so funny and entertaining. The food was amazing too. Definitely recommend!

name: Bobby Osbon
text: Always great food and great service.

name: laura campbell
text: Enjoyed good service and great food on both visits. We called ahead both times for reservations but looked like we would've been accommodated regardless. Beautiful decor. If we were in the area again we'd definitely return.

name: Voodoo Angel
text: Food and atmosphere is very good at this restaurant a little pricey wait staff is awesome.

name: Soon Ja Love
text: Excellent food, service, and entertainment. We had a great dining experience.

A lot of people was still in the restaurant, due to our food just being cooked. And the server stated they was not McDonald’s and other rude words! They're food was good. But I will not spend my money there again , unless I have a different server!!!!!

name: Roberta Campbell
text: I love eating at Fuji. However this time the food was not that great because the chef was new. I was able to get my order remade in the back though thankfully! Joy was a great waitress, very beautiful and funny!

text: They were good but i ordered steak & shrimp and he gave me steak & chicken.

name: josh Man
text: Love the atmosphere. And the food is good

name: Crystal Melvin
text: Good food, great service, and even a bit of entertainment at the hibachi tables.

name: Nathan Willeke
text: Udon noodles were overcooked and far too soft. Yaki udon did not taste stir fried at all, would not get again.

name: Noah Diaz-Mize
text: Always come here every once in awhile and always great. I would recommend this place

name: Lexie Cupp
text: Very nice hibachi restaurant with great lunch prices.  The waiter and cook were both very kind and helped to make our daughter's birthday special.

name: Earl Small
text: The wait was not too long, but well worth it. The food was prepared right in front of us (with flair) so the entertainment value was an added bonus. I have the chicken and shrimp combo with rice and veggies. A "must experience" dining event.

name: Leah Dyess
text: Amazing food and great atmosphere

name: Malcolm Bush
text: Fantastic!!!! Excellent service and food was prepared by very skilled chefs!!!! Highly recommended,  I don't even live here but whenever I do return this will be a prime spot!!! Took my Fiancee out for her Birthday here and she loved it as well!!!!!

name: James Price
text: Wonderful experience love the food like always employees are great

name: Colleen Sams
text: Great sushi !

name: Gilg Shawarma
text: Nice raw sushi, good rare steak, great spicy octopus. The seaweed tastes better than some of the fish!

name: Micheal Nansel
text: Was not the best experience I have had. Nothing wrong but it has been better for sure.

name: Lion-ell Daniel
text: Fuji is quite affordable for a nice lunch adventure.. the food is filling and the service was great..

name: Philip Mooney
text: Great place to eat, have been here multiple times over the past 5 years, something I realized last night 10/21/2017. Look at your bill closely before adding a tip I didn't notice until we returned to our hotel that the restaurant adds a 15% gratuity automatically when it's printed up. So our server got a total of a 35% tip. We enjoy the food it's always fresh and fast, will continue returning there to eat but no more added gratuity

name: Cayla McKinnon
text: Good food and service

name: Amber W.
text: Much rather go to shogun. The food was dry and lacked flavor to me. It was weird that it was served with a cherry on the side too. This was our first visit and I will probably stick with shogun from now on.

name: James Lawson
text: Always a great meal. Priced for what it is, but easier and quicker than similarly priced competitors

name: Mary Ann Ortiz
text: Always a delight to be seated at the grill and watch the chef cook. The majority of the times we are seated very quickly and there is minimal weight before the chef comes in to give his "show".

name: Harvey Earls
text: So much food! And it was delicious!

name: DONNA CALLAHAN
text: Came to days in a few and everyone seems to not know what is going on. Tried to sit us at a table that people were already eating. Had several families complaining because they still haven't recieved service. This place has been going down everytime we go and the sad thing is we love this place

name: Julie Etherton
text: Great Birthday Dinner! Joy, our waitress, was awesome. Our chef was amazing! Great experience for 20 people celebrating!

name: Carla Upton
text: Always spend daughter's birthday there  great food and fun

name: Javonia Chase-Davis
text: ...but... no social distancing.

text: Great food! Great staff! Never a disappointment

name: Kristi Kennedy
text: One of my favorite Japanese restaurants!!! Have been eating here since 2008!!!

name: Brent Ferguson
text: Chef was always interacting with the customers. Good show. Food was good. The sake.

name: Derick Davis
text: The food was very good, but the service was completely terrible!  We had a very large group where the adults sat separated from the kids in the same common room.  The waiter allowed my 9 year old to order a $25 meal!  All of the other kids had $10 orders.  You would think they would question such a ridiculous order or confirm with a parent first from a young child before bringing this type of bill to be paid later.  No! The male waiter and female manager  blamed me and took advantage of a child.

name: Lisa Hayes
text: The food was great and the hibachi cook was awesome/Server too and friendly but the manager was rude and nasty to us about our drinks and we spent $120 amongst all of us party of 5 she needs customer service skills!!! I would have gave 5 stars but because of the rude manager it gets a 3😠😠😠

name: Stacey Ballard
text: Probably my favorite hibachi/sushi joint in the area. Sushi is always fresh and delicious, paired with a bento box and you have more than enough to eat. I like their salad dressing (each restaurant has their own take on ginger dressings). Would recommend this restaurant to anyone.
