name: Robert M
text:
To start, I walked in and the hostess couldn’t be bothered to greet me, just finished whatever she was doing and asked how many, and if I wanted the grill. Let it slide, not that big a deal. She walks me to a table and needs to wipe it down. Sigh. Then she hands us 1 menu, so the three of us take turns.

It took nearly 15 minutes to get our drinks. And when the server came, he brought the 2 sodas, and claimed they were “still pouring” my beer. What? Oh well, we did need extra time since all three of us had to take turns with the one menu they gave us.

It was at this point we started to realize we weren’t cooling off from being outside. This place is warm, and the flare ups from the grill weren’t helping. Seems the owners are trying to cut down on the electricity bill by turning the AC to “vent”.

There were no napkins at the table, nor any utensils. When we asked for them, he just walked over to another table and grabbed one napkin that had a fork inside. I guess the three of us can share a napkin?

You would expect this if the place was super busy and they were short staffed. There were a few servers clearly with nothing to do. The table side wasn’t even half filled, and we were one of two tables that weren’t already eating. The grill side was very busy, but again, if this were the problem, why are there 4 servers just standing around by the sushi bar flapping their gums?

I order a refill on the beer just as the first arrives. You know, because it won’t take me 15 minutes to polish off a half pint. Our food didn’t take very long, about as long as it took for our drinks. The refill on my beer was nearly instantaneous. Things are looking up.

I had to ask for my menu when my food came. The description and what I got didn’t seem to match up. It didn’t. Okay. Fortunately the chicken katsu I got was essentially a plate filled with chicken, so it wasn’t like they were skimping on the meat, just the sides. It was very good. The other two ordered ramen. Ramen is not their specialty, apparently. Make some instant ramen at home, pour in some sesame oil, and top it with some chives and your protein of choice... you will do as well as they did. The ramen was also as expensive as a bowl of top notch ramen at a ramen shop - if you are going to charge high dollar for a bowl of ramen, do it right. We got a side of steak... very good. It was the hit of the table. The sushi we had was also good, and I felt it was fresh and reasonably priced - more so for us because this place offers a military discount.

The next time we see our server is when we are all finished. With our sides, our food, and our drinks. I’m Not one for servers being pests, but stop by for a refill every once in a while. I didn’t want to complain, I just wanted out. By this point I am sweating from the heat and just want to get in my car so I can blast the AC.

Overall, the service was the kicker for me. I think all the talent is working the grill side of the house, and may even try that someday. But the table side was irritating.

text: I give this place only 3 stars when I would in previous times have given it 5 stars. Anyone who has eaten at this restaurant for the last 3 years are aware of how they have cut down on the SIZE of the (TO GO RICE CONTAINERS, yet are still charging the same price ($2.99). If you are going to cut down on the containers( GIVE LESS RICE), (as if regular customers won't notice), then you should at least not charge THE SAME PRICE for LESS RICE.!!! That is a rip off. Restaurant owners need to understand that customers are NOT STUPID. Especially REGULAR CUSTOMERS. We KNOW when you have changed your containers in order to give your customers LESS for the SAME PRICE. Get it together Fuji Japan. I won't be eating at this restaurant until you give change the CONTAINERS for the TO GO RICE order BACK to the ORIGINAL SIZE. Then I will give you $2.99 for a side of rice. At this point the only thing good about this Restaurant is the YUM YUM Sauce. Oh yea, they've even went up on it. Its $5.00 instead of $3.50 for (you guessed it) A SMALLER CONTAINER THAN BEFORE!!!!! So disappointed in this place. Get a grip Fuji Japan. Get a Grip. Customers are SMARTER and PAY ATTENTION to more than you think. Okay good ppl. I'm done. ;)

name: Knoll Cindy
text:
Took my family to eat there Saturday night after a school function. We sat with a group of ladies and a small child. In my group it was my husband, our two children (5&3months), and myself. One lady from the other group ordered some type of sushi, which was completely raw when brought out. Nothing out of the norm except she thought it would be fried.  She declined the dish and didn't want to be charged. The waitress then had the manager come out to our table and told the lady she would have to pay for the dish since it was ordered. The lady began to state that she wasn't going to pay for something that she didn't eat. They exchanged some words at the table. I couldn't help but to overhear since I was the closest to the other group. The manager then said she was tired or "you people". Not sure how to take that. Did she mean "you people" as in trouble, or "you people" as in trying to get out of paying, or did she mean "you people" as in black? About this time I was thinking oh heck this is about to get real. The lady in the group then said something in the line of "you people" back to the manager. Now mind you this manager is at our table yelling back and forth with this customer while all her customers are watching things unfold. The poor guy cooking is trying to cook our food and get the heck out of the way. Everyone around has stopped enjoying their dinner and watching this as a spectator sport. The customer said just give me my bill for my drink and I will leave. Case closed you would think.....nope! The manager then walked off and and I do believe the customer at this point said something about the managers attitude and how it was disrespectful. Next thing I  know the manager threw the plate of sushi at the wall and started yelling back at the customer. A waitress then put her arm around the waist of the manager in an attempt to hold her back. Somehow the manager became free and decided to come stand over my children at the table and get into a yelling match with this customer who was still sitting in her chair at our table. The manager at that time bumped into my childs car seat that was sitting atop of a highchair. I finally had enough and was worried about the saftey of my children and told them that this was enough and if she knocked my childs carseat one more time it would be over. Mama bear had enough. At this time my husband had removed himself from his seat and told the manager to leave from standing behind our children. Finally the customer left. The manager never once came
back to apologize after 20 minutes my husband had to track down the waitress to refill our drinks that were completely empty. After paying we stopped by the desk to speak with the manager about how unprofessional this was, especially in front of our children. The manager just looked at us like we were wrong. I just told my husband to come on and lets head home it isn't worth it anymore. The manager and two male employees then said something in their native tongue and started laughing. This place if very unprofessional. The sushi was what, about 12 dollars. This could have been handled better by the customer and the manager! Not worth it!!!! Will not be returning which is sad because we ate there twice a month. Management needs some anger management classes.

We go in there and was accused of not paying the last time we were there even after showing that we wasnt there they still wanted us to pay for some ones bill from the 21st. Will never go back here again.

name: Linda Sylvester
text: This used to be an awesome restaurant but now it totally SUCKS!!!! The chef had an attitude from hell, the show (if you want to call it that) was nothing more than an egg in his chef's hat & a smoking onion volcano, he gave my friend regular steak instead of filet mignon & what was supposed to be pinot grigio tasted like bitter $2 crap! Since I asked for my filet to be cooked rare, I was given my rice & steak first, while everyone else at the grill sat there drooling, wondering why they didn't have one morsel of food on their plate. The vegetables didn't show up till the very last minute. We asked to talk to a manager & her only comment was can they make us something to go. REALLY lady??? Not even a discount for my friend who got the wrong order? I used to go here often but will NEVER go again & will make sure to tell every single person I know to stay as far away from this place as they can!!!
